alert.note: Alert for Eastern Glacier, Toole, Central, Eastern Pondera, Liberty; Lewis and Clark National Forest Rocky Mountain District-Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 16 at 2:06AM MDT until September 18 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 112 AND 114 BELOW 5000 FEET... The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a Red Flag Warning below 5000 feet for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon Sunday to 9 PM MDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Eastern Glacier/Toole/Central/Eastern Pondera/Liberty and Lewis and Clark National Forest Rocky Mountain District-Rocky Mountain Front. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. Winds will decrease to 10 to 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph Sunday night before increasing again Monday morning. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent Sunday. As low as 20 percent Monday. Poor overnight recovery expected Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Any existing or new fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and be difficult to contain. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in these areas of this Red Flag Warning.
